etymology.interpretation: Combines the bamboo element with 即 as the sound, evoking the joint or node on a bamboo stalk—a natural division point. By extension it denotes a section or boundary (texts, time → “festival”) and the idea of keeping within limits, hence “to economize.”
etymology.simplification: 節 was simplified to 节 by replacing the bamboo radical with 艹 and adopting 卩 as a simpler phonetic, reducing strokes while preserving the jié reading and a plant-related cue to the bamboo node sense.

examples.chinese: 春节是中国最重要的节日(春節是中國最重要的節日)。
examples.pinyin: Chūn Jié shì Zhōngguó zuì zhòngyào de jiérì.
examples.english: Spring Festival is China’s most important holiday.

examples.chinese: 我们要节约用水(我們要節約用水)。
医生检查了他的膝关节(醫生檢查了他的膝關節)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng jiǎnchá le tā de xī guānjié.
examples.english: The doctor examined his knee joint.
